poem:
Title: A Peer Among Princes

In the vibrant hum of Brixton,
In the youthful spin of pool balls,
Listens Khan amidst the beats,
And small studio hall echoes.

Recounts city escapades
And a cow's bemusing knack,
Playing out life's better charades,
Sharing tales alongside the track. 

Not a landslide, still he treads,
In the battle for mayoral stead.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s not going to be a landslide’: how will Sadiq Khan fare in the battle to be London mayor? At a youth club in Brixton, Sadiq Khan shoots some pool with a group of teenagers. He listens to some tracks recorded in the club’s small studio. He chats with them about a recent hiking trip. He recounts a visit to the countryside with his own youth club that included his first encounter with a cow.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘It’s not going to be a landslide’: how will Sadiq Khan fare in the battle to be London mayor? At a youth club in Brixton, Sadiq Khan shoots some pool with a group of teenagers. He listens to some tracks recorded in the club’s small studio. He chats with them about a recent hiking trip. He recounts a visit to the countryside with his own youth club that included his first encounter with a cow.
